title: Liu captures elusive figure skating gold for U.S.
content: Alysa Liu won the first women's figure skating gold medal for the United States in 24 years at the Winter Olympics in Milan on Thursday.

title: Golden goal: Keller, U.S. women top Canada in OT
content: Megan Keller scored the golden goal in 3-on-3 overtime as the United States women's hockey team won Olympic gold by beating archrival Canada 2-1.

title: Sources: NBA plans to enact anti-tanking rules
content: Commissioner Adam Silver informed the league's 30 general managers Thursday that the NBA plans to make anti-tanking rule changes for next season, sources told ESPN.

title: C's Brown not appeased by Beverly Hills' apology
content: The city of Beverly Hills apologized to Celtics star Jaylen Brown on Thursday over inaccuracies in a previous statement, but Brown continued to take issue with the police shutting down his All-Star Weekend brand event.

title: Indiana passes bill to lure Bears from Chicago
content: The Bears' search for a new home took a "meaningful step" forward Thursday, opening the door for the storied franchise to leave Illinois to potentially build a new, domed stadium in Indiana.

title: Sources: Brewers reward Murphy with new deal
content: The Brewers have given a new contract to two-time NL Manager of the Year Pat Murphy that makes him one of the highest-paid managers in MLB, sources told ESPN

title: Hornets' Ball 'blessed' he wasn't hurt in car crash
content: Hornets point guard LaMelo Ball said Thursday he feels "blessed" one day after being involved in a two-car crash in Charlotte.

title: Canada, Britain to meet for gold in men's curling
content: Canada beat Norway 5-4 in Thursday night's men's curling semifinals after losing to the Norwegians earlier in the day. The Canadians' opponent in Saturday's gold medal game will be Britain, which stunned Switzerland 8-5.

title: How Alysa Liu became the unlikeliest Olympic figure skating champion
content: Alysa Liu won Olympic gold on Thursday -- an unexpected fairy-tale ending to an up-and-down week for the U.S. figure skating team.

title: The NBA's 10 biggest offseason questions: Why this summer could get wild
content: How will teams such as the Lakers, Bucks, Warriors and Knicks attack the offseason? Here's everything Bobby Marks is watching.

title: What could the Eagles get back in an A.J. Brown trade? We crafted four offers
content: Brown could get traded this offseason. Could Buffalo be a good fit? Baltimore? Let's project his market with four offers and a verdict.

title: 32 candidates to get cut, traded and passed over this offseason: Names to watch
content: Let's pick out players who could use a change of scenery for the 2026 season, including David Montgomery.

title: Who are MLB's best first basemen? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: UCL talking points: PSG's comeback win, Bodø/Glimt surprise Inter, more
content: The first legs of the UEFA Champions League knockout playoffs are in the books, and we have a lot to review.

title: Power Rankings: How the Terps returned to the top 16
content: After riding a four-game losing streak into February, the Terps have turned it around, winning four in a row.

title: Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: 'Shoresy' hits the road with NHL superstars
content: The creator of the Hulu hit kept a diary of the live tour. He shares it ahead of the Season 5 U.S. debut.

title: Minnesota U12 hockey playoff spans three days, 12 OTs
content: The Cottage Grove Wolfpack emerged victorious Wednesday in a Minnesota U12 girls hockey postseason game that started Monday and ended Wednesday.

title: Is it happening again? Arsenal's stumble in title race follows familiar pattern
content: Arsenal's Premier League championship charge suffered yet another wobble on Wednesday, leaving many Gunners fans to wonder: "Is it happening again?"

title: No respite for World Cup fans affected by Trump travel restrictions
content: Members of the Haitian and Senegalese communities in the U.S. react to President Donald Trump's visa restrictions ahead of the World Cup.

title: Have F1's new-for-2026 regulations made the sport too complicated?
content: F1's star drivers have spent much of preseason criticizing the sport's new-for-2026 cars. They might have a point, but there are no simple solutions.

title: Humility, charitable foundation keep Larry Fitzgerald grounded after HOF nod
content: "It's an amazing, amazing thing to be a Hall of Famer, but the light bill still came," Larry Fitzgerald said, keeping life in perspective.

title: No union president -- in a CBA year? What's next for MLBPA after Clark shocker
content: With labor negotiations ahead, losing the union president is a shock. But the MLBPA has an opportunity to come out of this stronger.

title: Don't be surprised if ...  Tyrese Maxey is top points scorer
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Tyrese Maxey, Jayson Tatum and more.

title: Who can you count on to play the most down the stretch?
content: The best ability is availability, and while some stars are shut down, here are those who will be out there.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia: Picks, predictions, more
content: Two fighters and two trainers share their analysis and predictions for the Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia title fight.

title: Betting buzz: Seahawks tied with 10 others for highest win total
content: The champion Seahawks are among 11 teams whose win total opened at 10.5, the highest number on the board.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye move for Bayern's Goretzka
content: Arsenal are considering making a move for Bayern Munich midfielder Leon Goretzka. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: '11 jets shot down': Trump says '200% tariffs' threat forced India, Pak to stop fighting
content: Donald Trump claimed he averted war between India and Pakistan in May 2025 by threatening a 200% tariff on both nations. Speaking at his "Board of Peace" event, Trump cited Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif as validating his mediation efforts. India, however, has distanced itself from these claims, with Prime Minister Modi stating no foreign power mediated the situation.

title: 'My girl lay soaked in blood': 6-year-old dies in hit-and-run in Delhi
content: A tragic collision in Janakpuri, Delhi, claimed the life of a six-year-old girl and injured her grandmother when their e-rickshaw was hit by a speeding car. The grandmother recounted the harrowing incident, highlighting the lack of immediate assistance. Police have registered a case and apprehended the accused driver, with investigations ongoing.

title: 'Play like Vaibhav Sooryavanshi': Ashwin's bold take as India march into Super 8
content: India has advanced to the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup, showcasing strong collective effort despite not always being at their fluent best. Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted the team's batting depth and the crucial bowling spells from Varun Chakaravarthy and Jasprit Bumrah.  The article also notes other teams qualifying for the Super 8s and the 2028 World Cup.

title: India attends Donald Trump's inaugural Gaza Peace Board meeting as observer
content: India attended the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump’s Board of Peace on Gaza as an observer. The US committed $10 billion to the board, which aims for redevelopment and lasting peace in Gaza, though India has not joined as a member.

title: 'Can't blame everything on...': OpenAI CEO calls out tech companies for mass layoffs
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman criticizes companies for 'AI washing' – falsely blaming AI for layoffs driven by cost-cutting. While genuine job displacement by AI is coming, many firms use it as a narrative shield for over-hiring or restructuring. High-profile companies have even walked back AI-centric layoff claims, revealing more mundane reasons.

title: Stone-pelting at Durga temple triggers clashes in MP's Sehora
content: Tension erupted in Jabalpur's Sihora area late Thursday night after a youth allegedly vandalized a Durga temple's grills. The incident led to clashes and stone-pelting between two groups during Aarti and namaz. Police intervened, deploying heavy forces and lobbing tear gas shells to restore order.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 82,500
content: Stock market today: Equity benchmarks opened flat on Friday after a crash on Thursday due to escalating geopolitical tensions. While Nifty50 was above 25,450, BSE Sensex was near 82,500.

title: Explained: What is India’s Sarvam AI model that Google CEO Pichai is impressed with
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai lauded Sarvam AI for its advancements in local AI models tailored for Indian languages and contexts. The startup's AI model reportedly outperforms major players like Google's Gemini and OpenAI's ChatGPT in specific benchmarks, showcasing its potential for India's digital future.

title: 'India haven't been challenged yet': Virender Sehwag fires Super 8 warning
content: Former India opener Virender Sehwag expressed concerns about India's bowling strength ahead of the Super 8s, despite their dominant group stage. He highlighted that the bowling unit hasn't been truly tested, citing the Netherlands match where runs were conceded.  Mohit Sharma also questioned the death bowling combination, emphasizing the need for clarity against stronger opponents.

title: 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria' star Eric Dane passes away at 53 after battle with ALS
content: Beloved actor Eric Dane, celebrated for his roles in 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria', has passed away at 53. Dane bravely battled ALS, becoming a vocal advocate for awareness and research. He spent his final moments with his wife and daughters, leaving behind a legacy of passion and gratitude for his fans. His fight against the disease inspired many.

title: After CEO's 'exit' warning, Accenture now has an 'AI rule' for promotions
content: Accenture is tying senior staff promotions to AI tool usage, requiring "regular adoption" as a criterion for leadership roles. The consulting giant is also tracking individual weekly logins to its AI tools. The move follows CEO Julie Sweet's earlier warning that non-adapters would be "exited." Internally, some employees have pushed back, calling the tools "broken slop generators." The policy comes as Accenture's share price has fallen roughly 42% over the past year.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: IndusInd Bank, and UPL are the top stock recommendations by Bajaj Broking Research for February 20, 2026 with a 3-month horizon in mind. The brokerage also shares its view on Nifty and Bank Nifty:

title: 'They both reacted instantly': Chappell reveals Gavaskar, Dev’s quick stand for Imran Khan
content: Cricket legends, including India's Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar, have backed former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who is imprisoned and reportedly suffering from vision loss due to alleged medical negligence. Former Australian captain Greg Chappell initiated a petition for Khan's proper medical care, which has garnered support from numerous international captains.

title: 'Forced to consume liquor': Hyderabad minor gang-raped at knife point; rescued after 36 hours
content: A 16-year-old schoolgirl, missing since Monday, was rescued from a flat in Chengicherla after being raped by three individuals, including two juveniles. Police apprehended a 24-year-old habitual offender and one minor, while a third suspect remains at large. The survivor was lured to the location after meeting one of the juveniles.

title: NBA trade news: Warriors sign $60M Celtics big, skip Giannis chase
content: The Golden State Warriors have acquired Kristaps Porzingis from the Atlanta Hawks, trading away Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield. This move aims to bolster the frontcourt and scoring after Jimmy Butler's season-ending injury. While Porzingis offers valuable spacing and shooting, his durability remains a significant concern for the team's playoff aspirations.

title: Erik Karlsson says Sweden came to Olympics to face the US
content: Sweden's dominant 5-1 victory over Latvia has propelled them into a quarterfinal showdown with the undefeated United States at Milano Cortina. Key offensive performances from Zibanejad, Nylander, and Landeskog, coupled with Lucas Raymond's record-breaking assists, showcased Sweden's newfound chemistry. This win sets the stage for a crucial elimination game against their American rivals.

title: Kayla Nicole posts cryptic update as Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift move forward
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly just weeks away from one of the biggest events of their lives. As Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce stay busy with their wedding plans, his ex Kayla Nicole, has turned heads with her new social post. It seems the social media influencer has shared an update about her personal life amid their wedding.

title: HR executive on way home thrashed with bats in road rage in Gurgaon
content: An HR executive was brutally attacked with cricket and baseball bats by three men in Gurgaon. The assault occurred moments after his car was hit from behind near IMT Manesar. The victim sustained injuries and required hospitalisation. Police are examining CCTV footage to identify and apprehend the attackers. An FIR has been registered.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer blocks Donald Trump from using RAF bases for potential Iran strike
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer reportedly blocked Donald Trump from using RAF bases for strikes on Iran, citing legal concerns. This comes amid rising US-Iran tensions and US military build-up. Trump had publicly urged the UK not to cede control of Diego Garcia, a key base, and suggested its use for potential strikes.

title: 'Jana Nayagan': CBFC revising committee yet to begin the review
content: Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' faces further release delays as the CBFC revising committee has yet to begin its review. This setback rules out a February 2026 release, with even a March clearance unlikely to guarantee an immediate theatrical rollout. Makers await official word, impacting future release plans.

title: Get ready for 3rd phase of SIR in April: EC to 22 states/UTs, including Delhi
content: As April 2026 approaches, the Election Commission is poised to kick off the third phase of its focused voter list revision. After successfully navigating the initial rounds that included Bihar and a dozen other states, the commission has reached out to 22 remaining states and Union Territories, urging them to get ready for this pivotal electoral undertaking.

title: T20 World Cup: With wins over Australia, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe are this tournament's 'underdog' story
content: Zimbabwe had already defeated two previous champions, Australia and Sri Lanka, in the group stage. In the Super Eight, they will lock horns against two-time champions West Indies and India, and South Africa, the runners-up of the previous edition. Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza calls his team 'underdogs', but by no means are they pushovers. They are gaining momentum and have a captain who knows a thing or two about chasing against the odds.

title: Former Prince Andrew released 11 hours after arrest amid Epstein Files probe
content: Prince Andrew was released from police custody after being arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office. The former royal, brother to King Charles III, was detained for questioning regarding his links to financier Jeffrey Epstein. He has been released under investigation, with authorities continuing their inquiries. This marks a significant event for the British monarchy.

title: Did Megan Thee Stallion unfollow Klay Thompson after he surprised her with a Bentley?
content: Megan Thee Stallion and Klay Thompson have turned heads with their whirlwind romance. As Klay Thompson gifted her a luxurious car for her 31st birthday, soon rumors of the two unfollowing each other sparked chaos among fans. But here's the actual truth behind if the high profile couple actually removed each other.

title: Macron: Will raise India content in Rafale
content: French President Emmanuel Macron affirmed that Rafale jets will bolster India's military might and expressed commitment to increasing indigenous content in 'made-in-India Rafale' aircraft. He highlighted the expansion of defense cooperation, including potential joint production of fighter jets and helicopters, and expressed hope for further submarine tie-ups, underscoring the unique strategic partnership between the two nations.

title: 'O' Romeo' box office Day 7 and Day 8: Shahid starrer ends 1st week with Rs 72 crore haul
content: In the cinematic realm, Shahid Kapoor's latest film 'O' Romeo' has faced an uphill battle at the box office. Despite the actor's compelling performance, the storyline has left fans underwhelmed, contributing to a steady decline in ticket sales after its debut. As it stands after a week, the film has amassed about Rs 47 crore. Read on to know more in detail.

title: Indian Navy likely to commission third indigenous N-powered submarine by April-May
content: India's sea-based nuclear deterrent is set to be significantly bolstered with the upcoming commissioning of INS Aridhaman, the third indigenous Arihant-class nuclear-powered ballistic missile submarine. This larger vessel, capable of carrying long-range K-4 missiles, will enhance India's "second-strike" capability and move it closer to achieving continuous at-sea deterrence.

title: 'Babar Azam is nothing': Former Pakistan captain's brutal verdict after poor T20 World Cup show
content: Pakistan advances to the Super 8 stage of the T20 World Cup.  Former player Mohammad Yousuf criticizes Babar Azam's batting technique.  Yousuf suggests Azam's struggles have persisted for years.  Pakistan now prepares for Super 8 matches against New Zealand, England, and Sri Lanka.  The team's focus shifts to these upcoming crucial games.

title: DRDO conducts successful qualification test for Gaganyaan drogue parachute
content: India's Gaganyaan program received a significant boost with the successful qualification level load test of its drogue parachute at DRDO's RTRS facility. This dynamic test, simulating loads higher than maximum flight conditions, demonstrated India's capability in designing and manufacturing high-strength ribbon parachutes, marking a crucial step towards self-reliance in human spaceflight.

title: Thyroid, infection drugs get fresh safety warnings after national review
content: Two widely used medications, doxycycline and carbimazole, are set to receive stronger safety warnings. Regulators have identified potential mental health side effects for doxycycline and a rare but serious blood disorder linked to carbimazole. This proactive step aims to enhance patient safety by ensuring clearer information for both doctors and patients regarding these important, albeit uncommon, adverse reactions.

title: Certainty of enforcement crucial to road safety push: Road transport secretary
content: Strict enforcement, not just awareness, is crucial for curbing road accidents and rule violations, stated Union road transport secretary V Umashankar. He highlighted that certainty of enforcement, coupled with organized district-level action and strong institutions, will foster compliance and accountability.

title: 1st time after Manipur violence, CM gets Kukis and Meiteis on 1 platform
content: Manipur's Chief Minister virtually addressed displaced Meitei and Kuki-Zo families, offering cash relief and urging trust rebuilding. This marks the first joint outreach since ethnic violence erupted. While resettlement efforts are underway, mistrust persists, with displaced individuals sharing concerns about jobs, education, and healthcare access. The CM pledged support for students and security for patients.

title: 'Appeasing policy': Why SC flagged 'freebies culture' and cautioned states
content: The Supreme Court expressed serious concerns over the growing culture of freebies in states, warning it could hamper economic development and strain finances. Justices questioned whether indiscriminate distribution of benefits, without distinguishing between the needy and others, amounts to an appeasing policy that could weaken work culture and development efforts.

title: 'Someday, I won't be here': Trump says Board of Peace will oversee UN
content: America will boost the United Nations. President Donald Trump revealed plans to support the global body financially and ensure its proper functioning. This initiative is part of his peace plan for Gaza. Trump believes the UN has great potential and aims to help it achieve it. He also mentioned past successes in settling wars without UN involvement.

title: Accommodation row rocks Pakistan hockey: PHF chief resigns after banning captain
content: Pakistan Hockey Federation president Tariq Bugti resigned following a controversy over the national team's accommodation during their Australia tour. The issue gained traction after a video showed players with luggage on the street, despite the captain initially claiming all was fine.

title: Ranveer Singh’s Dhurandhar wraps up historic run as one of India’s biggest hits
content: Seventy-five days after its December 5, 2025 release, Dhurandhar continues to dominate the conversation — and the box office. The Ranveer Singh-led action drama completed a historic theatrical run on February 17, underlining its rare staying power in a post-pandemic market known for sharp weekend spikes and swift drop-offs.

title: Girl, 6, Dies In Delhi Hit-And-Run, Grandmother Says She Begged Driver For Help
content: A six-year-old girl lost her life after a speeding car hit the e-rickshaw she was travelling in with her grandmother, causing the vehicle to overturn in West Delhi's Janakpuri area.

title: Girl, 6, Dies In Delhi Hit-And-Run, Grandmother Says She Begged Driver For Help
content: A six-year-old girl lost her life after a speeding car hit the e-rickshaw she was travelling in with her grandmother, causing the vehicle to overturn in West Delhi's Janakpuri area.

title: '2 Attempts Were Made To Cut Deal With Imran Khan, He Refused': Pak PM's Aide
content: A close aide of Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that jailed former premier Imran Khan was offered a "deal" twice but he declined to accept it.

title: "I Don't Like Young, Handsome Men. Women I Like": Trump At Peace Board Meet
content: World leaders who accepted the invitation of President Donald Trump to join his new peace board were greeted in Washington on Thursday with a mix of fanfare and personal flattery.

title: Budget Battle Begins: Haryana Assembly Session Set For BJP-Congress Showdown
content: The political temperature in Haryana is soaring as the budget session kicks off today. With both the ruling BJP and the Congress sharpening their strategies, the state Assembly is bracing for a fierce confrontation that could dominate state politics.

title: "Tremendous Interest": Trump Orders Release Of Files On Aliens, UFOs
content: Donald Trump said Thursday he is ordering federal agencies to begin "identifying and releasing" government files related to UFOs and aliens, a move sought for decades by some Americans.

title: '200% Tariffs, 11 Jets Down': Trump Inflates His Claim On India-Pak Ceasefire
content: US President Donald Trump reiterated his claim that he mediated between India and Pakistan during the 2025 military standoff, claiming he had threatened to put 200 per cent tariffs on the two nuclear-armed neighbours if they didn't stop the fighting.

title: "Bad For Royal Family": Trump On Ex-UK Prince Andrew's Arrest Over Epstein Probe
content: US President Donald Trump said that the former English Prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest in connection with the late convicted sex offender and trafficker Jeffrey Epstein is a "shame" and "bad for the royal family."

title: Will Respond "Decisively" If Subjected To Military Aggression: Iran To UN
content: Iran told UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Thursday that Tehran will consider bases, facilities and assets of the "hostile force" in the region as legitimate targets if it faces military aggression.

title: Assam Opposition Parties Urge Congress To Finalise Alliance At Key Meet
content: Several opposition political parties in Assam held a crucial meeting in Guwahati on Thursday to discuss the formation of an opposition alliance ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Rishi Sunak By His Side, UK Deputy PM Reveals His India Connection
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and UK Deputy Prime Minister David Lammy shared the stage at the British High Commission in New Delhi, blending humour, shared heritage and discussion on AI during a fireside chat.

title: India, Switzerland Shape Global AI Rules As Leaders Meet At AI Impact Summit
content: Swiss President Parmelin is on a two-day visit to India to participate in the AI Impact Summit 2026, bringing renewed momentum to what both sides described as a "friendly and multifaceted" relationship.

title: "AI Can't Yet Fix Delhi's Traffic": Rishi Sunak Jokes After Arriving Late At Summit
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak made a light hearted remarks on Delhi's traffic congestion as he apologised for the delay in the joint session with UK Deputy PM David Lammy at the British High Commission here.

title: India-UAE Ties Get AI Boost As Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Wraps Key Delhi Visit
content: India and the UAE on Thursday deepened their fast-expanding strategic partnership with a strong push on artificial intelligence, advanced technology and investment, as Abu Dhabi Crown Prince concluded a two-day official visit to India.

title: F-22 Raptors, F-35 Lightnings: US Unleashes Massive Air Armada, Iran Watches
content: The US military has assembled the greatest amount of air power in the Middle East since the 2003 invasion of Iraq by sending significant numbers of cutting-edge F-35 and F-22 jet fighters and support aircraft to the region.

title: Advantage BJP As 37 Seats Up For Grabs In Big Rajya Sabha Battle
content: The race for the Rajya Sabha is set to intensify with elections to 37 seats across 10 states scheduled for March 16, and early trends suggest the BJP-led NDA could further consolidate its position in the Upper House.

title: Immigration Officer Loses Rs 79 Lakh In Cryptocurrency Investment Fraud
content: A 41-year-old immigration officer working at Malaysia's consulate general office in Mumbai has lost nearly Rs 79 lakh in a cryptocurrency investment scam, police said on Thursday.

title: 55% Indian Americans Disapprove Of Trump's India Policies: Survey
content: The 2026 Indian American Attitudes Survey released by Carnegie Endowment for International Peace revealed deep dissatisfaction of Indian Americans with US President Trump's second term, particularly his handling of bilateral relations with India.

title: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Apologises After Heated Exchange Between BJP, Congress MLAs
content: A heated exchange between Madhya Pradesh minister Kailash Vijayvargiya and Leader of Opposition Umang Singhar was seen in the State Assembly during the budget session on Thursday, leading to disruptions and repeated adjournments of the House.

title: Trump Says Iran Has 15 Days To Make Nuclear Deal As Military Buildup Grows
content: He warned at the event in Washington that the United States "may have to take it a step further" without any agreement, adding: "You're going to be finding out over the next probably 10 days."

title: IT Minister Priyank Kharge meets Anthropic team, indicates Karnataka to work closely with AI firm
content: The interaction covered Anthropic’s plans for its Bengaluru office and opportunities to work closely with Karnataka’s technology and startup ecosystem

title: Gram panchayat member caught taking ₹1.7 lakh bribe in Thane district
content: According to the ACB, the complainant had constructed a three-story building after securing all necessary permissions. He applied to the gram panchayat in October 2025 for the assessment and levy of property and water taxes for the building

title: By donating organs to others, deceased Kerala baby now immortal: Jharkhand CM
content: Hemant Soren said that his government would take all steps to strengthen the State's organ donation policy

title: Mild tension at Amberpet during Shivaji Jayanti procession
content: The incident was reported after 10 p.m. when a group taking part in the procession allegedly shouted slogans in front of the Jamia Masjid while prayers were being conducted inside

title: India AI Summit 2026 Day 5 LIVE: India to formally join U.S. led effort on AI, supply chain security-Pax Silica today
content: The AI Impact Summit’s expo has been extended by one day, to February 21, so that attendees can visit with more flexible security arrangements, IT Secretary S. Krishnan said

title: A tribal hamlet’s tryst with AI-assisted tools
content: In the remote hills of Kumram Bheem Asifabad district, Limbuguda — home to less than 40 Kolam families — is witnessing a quiet transformation. A state-of-the-art Multipurpose Centre, established under the PM-JANMAN scheme, is leveraging AI-assisted learning tools to improve education, alongside healthcare and nutrition services, reshaping aspirations in one of Telangana’s most marginalised PVTG habitations

title: ‘Fireman’ to ‘Firefighter’: Karnataka to introduce 10% quota for women in recruitment
content: The decision follows directions issued during a meeting of the Union Ministry of Home Affairs to encourage greater participation of women in fire services across the country

title: Sandalwood: An expensive fragrance
content: India was the world’s leading producer of sandalwood until the last century, but it was displaced by Australia. What led to this fall, and what does the recent Union Budget’s offering to collaborate with States to revive the sandalwood industry in India mean for farmers? Chetan B.C. explores.

title: Cough syrup-linked deaths: Do you realise what dent it caused to country's image, Supreme Court asks pharma firm
content: The order summoned the firm and some of its officials on a complaint alleging various violations, including the manufacture and sale of drugs declared "not of standard quality"

title: Jammu and Kashmir’s Kishtwar admn. calls for regulation of Ramzan charity, evokes criticism from NC, PDP
content: Pankaj Kumar Sharma, DC of Kishtwar, in the order expressed fears that “during the holy month of Ramadan, there is a tendency for unregulated and unauthorized collection of donations, which necessitates immediate regulatory intervention”

title: Reassessing Periyar E.V. Ramasamy’s take on Tamil, which he called a barbarian language
content: The Dravidar Kazhagam founder believed that Tamil lacked sufficient literature that would pave the way for human development and cultivation of scientific temper.  ‘It is my anguish that Tamil could not become a language of science and rationalism like English,’ he wrote while defending his characterisation of the language

title: Udhagamandalam’s own Charing Cross and its London disconnect
content: It has long been the entrance to the headquarters of The Nilgiris district. It shares its name with a junction in Westminster, London, where six routes meet. Hence, many believe that the Charing Cross in Udhagamandalam is modelled on the one in London

title: A tall leader of Tamil Nadu belonging to what was once known Depressed Classes
content: J. Sivashanmugam Pillai was the first Scheduled Caste member to become the Tamil Nadu Assembly Speaker in 1946. He was known for impartiality, with former CM Kamaraj saying, ‘Though a Congressman, he held the scales even.’ He demitted the office in 1955 to become Member of the UPSC and was elected to the Rajya Sabha in 1962

title: A temporary relief from bonded labour
content: A landmark law formulated to end bonded labour in India marks its 50th year of passing. Satyasundar Barik examines the Act’s relevance and effectiveness through the voices of labourers in Odisha who slipped back into bondage even after being officially rescued

title: 15,849 vehicles with same chassis, engine number registered in multiple Northeast States: CAG
content: The latest audit report flagged contract carriage permits for school buses in Assam, resulting in the bypassing of mandatory fitness tests

title: Petitions filed in Patna High Court challenging election of several MLAs, court issues notices
content: The petitions have been filed by the candidates who lost the election from their respective constituencies

title: Trump repeats claim he ended conflict between India and Pakistan; said he threatened 200% tariffs on countries
content: Donald Trump repeated the claim that he stopped eight wars within the first year of his second term in the White House as he addressed an event of the Board of Peace in Washington

title: Post-viral prolonged cough a cause for concern, say medical experts
content: While hospitals in Ernakulam have not reported a spike in viral infections and post-viral cough cases, patients have been seeking treatment for prolonged cough

title: Travel operators seek road tax relief, rollback of 3% cess in pre-Budget memorandum
content: To help achieve the targets under the Tourism Policy 2024–29, the association sought tax exemptions or reductions for tourist vehicles, including mini buses, multi-utility vehicles

title: India attends Trump's Board of Peace meeting as observer nation
content: India has not joined the Board of Peace, which has been set up by Mr. Trump for the redevelopment of the Gaza Strip

title: Heritage Dairy never compromised on quality, says Bhuvaneswari
content: Each one of the products reaches the customers only after passing 25 quality tests, says its Vice-Chairperson and Managing Director

title: Ponniyathangam festival draws crowds, praise from Chief Minister
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan spends over half an hour watching high-energy Kalaripayattu performances at the Ponniyathangam festival, praising its growing public appeal. The event features martial arts displays, cultural competitions and musical performances, drawing enthusiastic crowds and participants from across the country.

title: Indian Americans largely disapprove of Trump’s first year job performance, but Democrats do not benefit: Survey
content: Broken down by policy areas, the disapproval rates are 64% for immigration policies, 68% for domestic economic policy and 70% for international economic policy (trade, tariffs, sanctions)

title: Kerala Minister Sivankutty launches State-level construction of model autism centres
content: Minister says autism complexes intended to prioritise individual learning and therapy of differently abled

title: Green protocol to be tightened for Attukal Pongala fete
content: District Collector Anu Kumari releases brochure of ‘Bhakthikku Vritthi Mukhyam’ mega campaign prepared by disrict Suchitwa Mission

title: Anil Ambani assures Supreme Court he has no plans or intention to leave the country

title: Improper landing technique by trainee pilot led to serious incident at Kalaburagi Airport: DGCA probe

title: Karnataka makes NABH or NQAS accreditation mandatory for all blood centres

title: Patient care services at medical college hospitals in Kerala hit by doctors’ strike
content: Medical college doctors, who have been on an indefinite boycott of outpatient clinics and teaching activities, have suspended all non-emergency surgeries and procedures since Thursday

title: PMLA court orders restitution of ₹65 crore assets in Popular Group case
content: The properties, movable assets worth ₹33.20 crore and immovable assets worth ₹31.87 crore, were attached by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a case registered on September 17, 2020

title: Governor tells V-Cs to abide by Kerala HC directive on campus politics

title: Top moments: United States wins gold medal game over Canada in overtime
content: Emily Kaplan looks ahead to the U.S. women's hockey team's gold medal game against Canada. (0:43) It all came down to this at the 2026 Olympic Games for the two most dominant countries in international women's hockey. The United States and Canada faced off Thursday for the gold medal. After a thrilling back-and-forth game, the U.S. won 2-1 in overtime on a goal by Megan Keller. Women's ice hockey was first introduced at the Olympics in 1998, and these are the only two countries to have won Olympic gold since. Canada won gold four years ago in Beijing, but the U.S. swept this winter's Rivalry Series and defeated Canada 5-0 in the preliminary round. More:   U.S.-Canada is the rematch everyone wanted   |  U.S. favored in gold medal game Here are all the goals and top moments from the game.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S. men's hockey faces Slovakia in semis and more
content: no. 3 seed dominated germany 6-2 to advance to the men's freeski halfpipe final . team USA will face Slovakia in the semifinals after hanging on to defeat Sweden in overtime on Wednesday . americans Nick Goepper and Alex Ferreira will compete for gold .

title: One proposal fixes the NBA’s tanking problem: Turning losses into wins

title: Kota man arrested for threatening to shoot Rahul, 25 Cong MPs in video posted online
content:
Rahul Gandhi

Kota: A man was arrested Thursday in Rajasthan's Kota for allegedly threatening to shoot leader of opposition Rahul Gandhi and 25 other Congress MPs in a video he posted online, citing their alleged verbal abuse of Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla during the budget session. Raja Singh Amera claims to be a spokesperson of Karni Sena. But both Karni Sena and BJP have distanced themselves, stating he has no formal ties to either organisation. Birla is Kota's BJP MP. In the 0.55-second video clip, Amera said he and others would vandalise the MPs' homes and shoot them "one by one." He also said the administration would be responsible if such an act took place. Kota City SP Tejeshwani Goutam said Amera faced four previous cases. The fresh case has been registered under sections 351, 352 and 353 of BNS, pertaining to criminal intimidation, breach of public peace and mischief.

End of Article
